title: Violent and sex offenders escape prosecution after confessing serious crimes
text:
Violent thugs, sex offenders and drug traffickers are among thousands of criminals who have escaped prosecution after confessing to serious crimes, The Telegraph can reveal.

Police have used out-of-court disposals which include warnings, cautions and community resolutions to deal with serious offences including sex assaults, violence with injury and possession of weapons.

A smaller number of rapes, robberies and arsons were also dealt with by out-of-court disposals, according to a Telegraph analysis of official police force data from 2016 to 2019.
